Comment 8: 
Go is not going to forbid complex64 in structs.  As I said before, complex64 is not the
problem.

I think that Go should forbid referring directly to C structs with fields whose
alignment can not be represented in Go.  There are many ways to handle this case, the
most obvious being, don't use a struct.  Or, for the particular special case of a
misaligned complex64 field, use [2]float32.
